subject: enable multiple keystone-all worker processes
commit_message:
enable multiple keystone-all worker processes

Fixes bug 1157261.

Since the majority of the work keystone does is cryptographic
calculations and filtering database records, keystone is CPU-bound.
Given that a keystone-all process has only one thread (i.e.,
eventlet's thread), keystone-all's throughput is limited to the
throughput of a single CPU core. To increase keystone-all's
throughput, we need to increase its CPU parallelism, which entails
running more keystone-all processes.

This patch adds two configuration options, public_workers=N and
admin_workers=N, that determine the number of keystone-all processes
that handle requests for keystone's public and admin WSGI applications
respectively.

Note that simply running keystone-all multiple times won't work
because care has to be taken for all of the worker processes to be
using the same socket (i.e., listen() then fork()).

DocImpact

subject: Add include_disabled param to pkg search
commit_message:
Add include_disabled param to pkg search

Currently, the api endpoint function for listing
packages returns all packages by default.  This
commit adds a new 'include_disabled' parameter
which, when specified by an admin as 'True',
results in the packages search results including
disabled packages from all users in addition to
all enabled packages.

When the include_disabled parameter is specified
'True' by non-admins, the search will include
both all enabled packages (public and owned), plus
only the disabled packages owned by the searcher.

If a non-admin specifies 'True' for the
include_disabled paramater AND also specifies
the 'owned' parameter, then the non-admin gets
all of their own packages, public and private,
both enabled and disabled.

This commit effectively disables the 'owned'
parameter for admin users.  It is the only way
to make the package search API function
usable for both generating views of packages
for deployment as well as views of packages
for editing packages.

subject: Get quota and usage from neutron for limit APIs
commit_message:
Get quota and usage from neutron for limit APIs

On a system configured to use Neutron, for limit API, we should retrieve
quota and usage for floating IPs and security groups from Neutron,
rather than Nova DB.

We do this just in V2 API since leaving the limits code broken in V2 API
when working with Neutron is the wrong choice. In V3 API we have better
separation between Nova and Neutron since Nova doesn't proxy any
requests to Neutron for V3.

In this patch the neutronv2 API translates NuetronClientException to
NovaException with the proper code (401, 403 or 500) and that is raised
back to the os-compute API which uses the new error map in the common
module to raise the HTTP error back to the client.

The status code stuff with NovaException is a bit ugly, but there wasn't
a good 401/403 choice in NovaException already. There is a NotAuthorized
exception but it sets a 403 code, and there is a NotAllowed
NovaException but that's for a 405. So rather than define new confusing
NovaExceptions, this patch just sets the code in the NovaException that
comes back from the neutronv2 API and lets the os-compute API code
translate it.

There are also TODOs in the os-compute API code to eventually define
common abstract methods in nova.network.api.API so that nova-network and
Neutron can be handled the same way in os-compute API, but that's for a
later patch since it's a good bit of work and not necessary for this bug
fix.

subject: Avoid the possibility of truncating disk info file
commit_message:
Avoid the possibility of truncating disk info file

Commit dc8de42 makes nova persist image format to a file to avoid
attacks based on changing it later. However the way it was implemented
leaves a small window of opportunity for the file to be truncated before
it gets written back to effectively making it possible for data to get
lost leaving us with a potential problem next time it is attempted to be
read.

This patch changes the way file is updated to be atomic, thus closing
the race window (and also removes the chown that we did not really
need).

It is worth noting that a better solution to this would be
to allow the code calling the imagebackend to write the file (once!)
and make it impossible to update after the boot process is done. This
approach would require more refactoring of the libvirt driver code, and
may be done in the future.

subject: Spawn support for TaskManager and 2 locking fixes
commit_message:
Spawn support for TaskManager and 2 locking fixes

There's a number of cases where we grab a lock and then spawn a worker
to complete an action. Since the TaskManager() is not being used as a
context manager in these cases, it's really easy to mess this up and
create a code path where we accidentally leave a node locked.

This patch adds support to TaskManager to allow you to spawn a worker
on __exit__. This consolidates all of the logic to make sure we unlock
a node when we should. All cases where we lock and spawn a worker have
been updated to use this.

This happens to fix a bug in set_console_mode() where there's a path
that can leave a node locked. If the console is already in the
appropriate mode, it doesn't spawn a worker, however it would leave
the node locked.

This also fixes a bug in _check_deploy_timeouts() where if the spawn
failed due to something other than NoFreeConductorWorkers or if
the thread-finished-callback linking failed, we would leave a node
locked.

Tests where we're actually testing eventlet's thread behavior with
respect to link() have been moved to the task_manager test file.
They were refactored to remove unnecessary sleeps and incorrect
assumptions about eventlet scheduling. (They assumed that a spawn()
scheduled the new thread immediately.)

self._spawn_worker() tests in test_manager were also moved to their own
test class to be true unit tests.

commit_message:
Deprecate nova-manage flavor subcommand

The nova client already has the following flavor commands:

flavor-access-add    Add flavor access for the given tenant.
flavor-access-list   Print access information about the given flavor.
flavor-access-remove Remove flavor access for the given tenant.
flavor-create        Create a new flavor
flavor-delete        Delete a specific flavor
flavor-key           Set or unset extra_spec for a flavor.
flavor-list          Print a list of available 'flavors' (sizes of
flavor-show          Show details about the given flavor.

This covers what nova-manage flavor was providing so let's deprecate the
legacy nova-manage subcommand and mark it for removal in the K release.

completely duplicated in nova client. It is accessing the database
directly and we want to move to using flavor objects which would go
through conductor. So this could be considered part of the objects
conversion for flavors.

leave those so you can access the database before the api service is

subject: Explicit foreign key indexes.
commit_message:
Explicit foreign key indexes.

Overview:
MySQL requires indexes on foreign keys. Such an index is created on the
referencing table automatically if it does not exist.

Motivation:
MySQL names foreign keys indexes differently dependent from itself
version. Implicit fk indexes is MySQL specific behavior, so it should be
ignored during comparision. We plan to use Alembic to compare models and
migrations I0758c7e09d1d46ce870c3f94f76c2a177955e143. Alembic doesn't support
5.5 naming convention. So we need consistent index name for all MySQL versions
to be easily ignored.

Solution:
A new migration script renames incorrectly named fk indexes on MySQL.

Reproduction:
Stop execution when foregn keys will be initialized. See schema with
your MySQL shell client. With 5.5, indexes which was not named
explicitly, will have a name such as <tablename>_<columnname>_fk, with 5.1 it
will be <columnname>.
